author: gdaniels
msg: Change Chain iteration to use a HandlerIterationStrategy, so that
one iteration routine can handle invoke() and generateWSDL().
Later on we can expand this to include generating deployment
data as well.
Put HTTP-specific properties into the MessageContext which we
pass down for getting WSDL from a service.  This lets the
URLMapper work if it's deployed.
Pass allowedMethods into the WSDL generator - next step is to
actually output WSDL only for allowed methods.

author: gdaniels
msg: Reformat to 80 chars lines

author: gdaniels
msg: Put in a result name which will match what we actually send.

author: gdaniels
msg: Simplify SOAPEncoding (since type attrs are added by the
TypeMappingRegistry already), enable switching the sending
of xsi:type attributes on and off via the ServiceDescription,
and add a unit test for same.

author: gdaniels
msg: Use correct namespace for soap: in WSDL docs
Remove pathInfo check on servlet.  What really should happen here
is probably that gets should have an equivalent generateHTML
method which gets called on the handler chains, letting them construct
their own web pages... alternate we could call generateWSDL and then
build an HTML page with XSLT based on the WSDL document....
